snippet: At least 44 died and hundreds were reported injured in the blasts, which caused a huge fireball in the city, about 90 miles east of Beijing.
abstract: Multiple blasts at warehouse in Tianjin, China, where hazardous cargo was being stored leaves more than a dozen people dead and hundreds more injured; damage from fiery inferno appears to be extensive.

byline.contributor: Alan Wong contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Yufan Huang contributed research from Tianjin.

lead_paragraph: At least 44 died and hundreds were reported injured in the blasts, which caused a huge fireball in the city, about 90 miles east of Beijing.

headline.main: Tianjin, a Port in China, Is Rocked by Explosions That Killed Dozens
headline.print_headline: Damage Appears Heavy as Deadly Blasts Rock a Port in China

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Rui Hai International Logistics Co Ltd
